title: So what the fuck? Did Riot back out of removing TP from the game?
body: I just saw Meddler's notes on 8.5, there is nothing said about Teleport. After threatening to remove it from the game a day ago, suddenly adding more ambiguity to it is not very reassuring to someone already holding off from playing the game until more is said about it.

Uh......no? I'm sorry, but you are horribly misinformed.

Deathfire Grasp was removed because Riot couldn't figure out how to make it *not* a problem without making it an entirely different item. So, it was easier to just remove it.

Revive was removed because it had be at such a low power level, that it was essentially useless. Remember the first time URF was released? EVERYONE was running Tele and Revive. That gives you a good representation of what would happen if Revive could have competed with the other summoner spells.

Atma's Impaler was removed because Garen was the only champ who would ever build it. If they were to buff it to a point that other champs would use it, they would have had to nerf Garen into the ground and make it to where he either solely relied on it, or was completely useless.

Executioner's Calling was *initially* removed for the same reason why Atma's Was removed.......*no one built it*. It was either uff the item to God Tier levels, or remove it. However, unlike Atma's, they brought it back completely reworked, since AD did not have any option for Grevious Wounds.

All of these weren't removed *just because* they were a problem, they were removed because Riot couldn't properly fix the problem they were presenting. In each case, it was easier to remove them because if Riot tried to fix the problem, they may have created 10 more problems in the process.

I had an idea on the issue I'd like to hear a comment on:

What if TP became a mastery, similar to Hextech Flashtraption.
Something to the effect of "Traveler's Flashstone - Replaces Flash with Teleport."

That way TP would at least see a change in what champions are viable with it, since it precludes the use of Flash as a summoner spell.
I'd argue it's a good idea to at least try, given the similar play-making potential of both abilities.
I don't think anyone would ever take that apart from singed and olaf, and maybe Nasus. Flash is simply too strong to give up.
Make TP channel faster, but nerf the range on the summoner if you're looking to change the spell.

Make the tp into a channeled gateway that can be destroyed at the "arrival area" to prevent otherwise badly placed tp ganks, there is no reason someone should be unable to stop a tp from the destination instead.

I don't see the issue with teleport as it is, because it's meant to be used for making impactful plays across the map.  Perhaps there could be ways to negate a tp on the destination end, like giving tons of armor to a minion but not invulnerability, or something along those lines.  You could also implement ways for the channel to be interrupted on either end.

Would it be worth looking into evening out its end results after being cast?  I have always thought it was weird that the spell renders wards and minions invulnerable yet fizzles when the tower its cast on falls.  I'm not trying to make a case for either, just curious to know if this was considered.

Here's a Link to a proposed TP change I've suggested.

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/general-discussion/LoWEoiAn-teleport-balance?show=flat&page=1

I'll post the TL;DR

*TP is taken on at least one champion pretty much every game because it's safe and rewards the player using it for a variety of advantages such as ganking, laning, team fighting, objectives, etc. and therefor makes the game strategically stagnant and unappealing as riskier play styles are overshadowed by safe laning patterns supported by the current version of TP.

*Proposed Change/Rework for TP is to have it work like Ekko's ult, but instead of giving back the health percentage a few seconds ago, Teleport will remember your health percentage the last time you have activated Recall in the past 20 seconds. So if you use TP right after Recall, you will TP in with the health % you had at the time you last used Recall. To balance this laning disadvantage, Telelport's cool-down would be lowered and it can be used on any part of the map that you have vision of. This would mean it no longer needs a ward, minion, or tower to be used on; opening up new gank paths, better team fight positioning, and more frequent and appealing plays over all thereby helping his teammates carry even harder. This would also mean that a high-risk aggressive laning play-styles can try to gain an advantage in-lane and translate that into the mid and late-game; this creates a viable way for both play-styles to have an opportunity to succeed.
